title: Wonderful Experience Delivery Suite and Maternity…
body:
My daughter was born in the delivery suite here. It wasn’t a straightforward birth  and I wanted to say how brilliant all of the staff were throughout, and thank them for making what could have been a traumatic experience into something I will look back on with nothing but positives to say about the care and treatment I received. 

Everyone was kind, professional and caring, and incredibly hard-working. All of the midwives and doctors I saw took the time to explain carefully what was happening at each point of my labour, as well as listening to my preferences and discussing potential outcomes, which was so appreciated. I was left completely in awe of the staff and grateful for the services we are so privileged to receive on the NHS. 

It is obvious how hard the staff work. One of the student midwives assisting even stayed long past the end of her shift, and staff who were present at the birth came to speak to me and my husband afterwards to give us opportunity to ask any questions about the process, which was really appreciated.
I really want to say the biggest thank you to everyone in the Delivery Unit for the support I received during a scary time for the incredible care they showed. I really couldn’t thank them enough and will always be so grateful to them for their exemplary work.

title: Useless trying to get appt
body: My wide needed a general appt with a doctor. Advised her normal Dr has no appts until Dec and to call in two days time when appts will be available or see if she could book online. Calling on thursday is not a convenient option and online doesnt list a routine appt selection so cannot do online either. What is she supposed to do?

title: Terrible booking system - stay far away
body: Spent 4 hours across 4 days on the phone waiting for an appointment. You have to spend the first hour from 8am dialling the number over and over as the call drops or the line says its too busy and cancels the call repeatedly. Once you get on the waiting list, theres 30 people in the queue and by the time you speak to somebody, all the appointments are gone. You are then told you should have called earlier (despite there being no chance of getting through on the phone) or booking through the app. The app doesn't let you book phone consultations for most issues other than prescriptions so its very useless advice. I then decided I would pay privately out of frustration, asked for a telephone appointment to get a referral and they didn't have a slot for 3 weeks. Awful awful service, useless staff answering phones & terrible booking system.

title: Great practice
body: Explain very good all steps I have to do with my problems. The assistant helped me to booked an appointment for next check

title: Room for improvement
body: Tried for 4 days to get appointment although ringing in at the right times could not even get in the queue for a good 10 minutes something needs to be done we should be allowed to see a doctor that day or at the very least the following day.

title: Great practice
body: Saw my Doctor on Tuesday at 10.00am for a womens problem. Had a text from Stepping Hill at 11.30 the same day with appointment on the following Friday. Fabulous service. Thank you NHS

title: Great experience
body:
The e-consult system was easy to use and much more convenient than waiting on hold. A telephone appointment was made for me the following week. My telephone appointment was sufficiently long enough to address my issue. My only suggestion would be to provide some flexibility around dates/times as I would have preferred to wait a few more days, if required, to book a more convenient time. 
The Doctor was friendly and listened to all of my concerns. They were knowledgeable and I feel comfortable going to them for medical advice in the future. Thank you!

title: Professional practice
body: Reception are always so helpful and nice. The practice is clean, well informed, well displayed. Waiting time hasn’t been long. Nurse I had was very professional, welcoming, relatable and made me feel comfortable. She also explained what was happening, asked all the questions and follow up agreed/clear.

title: Top Doctors
body:
have been a patient at Armley for years and can not think of any other surgery I would like to use. Unfortunately I have to use their services more than I would like and this frustrates me as I often feel like I will never get better well maybe improve not better and this really stresses me out. The doctor I currently see and have done for the last few years I can not thank enough. She always recommends medication that will help and she checks I am okay. I am not the best at explain things so don't make it easy but most of the time she understands me, she makes feel really comfortable so don't get too nervous. I believe that she would go out of her way to help anybody and genuinely cares. God knows where I would be without her.

I struggle with communication sometimes miss understand things on a daily basis but the practice manger is amazing at explaining things. She clearly wants to make this doctors the best it can be and wants to help all patients. A few years ago I had an infection and ignored it until it got worse. The surgery was closed as it was the weekend so I sent an email I didnt expect anything until the following week but I got an email Sunday afternoon and by Monday I had some antibiotics. Doubt I would get that anywhere else.

You can't please everybody but I know the manager really wants to


There is also a nurse there who is lovely, she has patched me up many times. She is really kind, I always ask for her.She did pull me up on something last visit which I stewed on for a bit but she was right

I had help from a social prescriber and I really warmed to her, she helped me with a phone call and spoke for me when got stuck.

There is many other staff there who I am sure they are just as good. One GP who I didnt really take to and knows this had to see me for a while and even though he knew I was not too keen he looked after me. One instance that sticks with me was when he agreed to contact somebody for me, I hadn’t even got home before he called me to say he had tried they were not available but would keep me updated. I was very grateful and was really impressed with that

Thank you Armley for looking after me and doing what you can to make sure I have the pain relief I need

title: We have again cancelled your appointment
body:
I just want to 'thank you from the bottom of my heart' for your letter informing me that you have cancelled my appointment to which I have been waited a six months. Sadly, this is not the first time. Shockingly, you have even failed to provide any reason. 

I love how the letter states 'this cancellation does not affect any other appointments that you may have'. What appointments? You tend to cancel any appointment shortly before their date. 

Ahh, belowed NHS ... always wants more monies, always struggle, always is overwhelmed.

author: Indigo Man
title: Trying to contact my GP
body:
Nearly 8 weeks to get access to a 20 minute GP appointment and I receive the reason such as staff shortages etc.  
I felt this was dire service.

title: Nuclear medicine
body: The whole team in this department are friendly, welcoming and help to put you at ease, Thankyou for making a stressful day easier

title: Brilliant treatment
body: I was sent by my GP with aa suspected DVT.  I could not have been cared for better.  I was treated promptly and informed by caring staff what was happening throughout blood tests and a scan.  I have nothing but the greatest praise for all staff.  Thank you!

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very professional and friendly
body: Had a nurse appointment for cervical screening - she was extremely friendly and kind, very professional. Not painful or uncomfortable procedure at all even though I was worried it might be because she was really kind and obviously very skilled. She put my mind at ease. Thank you.

title: The best practice in Banbury
body: Very good service always helpful and you get through on the phone very quickly and get an appointment the best practice in Banbury by far

title: Excellent
body:
I was referred to the Gp treatment area through 111.
This is in the A&E area at West Suffolk Hospital.
The ED sister I met was excellent and realising my problem directed me to the right area . It was very busy in the A&E waiting area, but she was very calm and professional.
I was very lucky to get seen almost immediately and cannot fault the care and attention and kindness given to me.
Many thanks

title: Covid booster
body:
Fantastic service. Very well organised. All the staff were friendly. 
From booking to having the booster  every stage was easy to understand and swift to complete.

title: Nuclear medicine
body: The whole team in this department are friendly, welcoming and help to put you at ease, Thankyou for making a stressful day easier

title: Flu clinic
body: I attended the flu clinic today at Corfe Hills School.  The whole process was managed very efficiently; dividing those on blood-thinners from the rest and then passing quickly to the line of treatment stations where my personal details were checked along with my pulse.  The injection was painless and I was on my way within 5-minutes of arrival.  The location with lots of parking is ideal.

title: Much better service than other practices I hear of
body: Although there's a wait to get through on phone, it's not too bad. I was offered a choice of phone consultation or face to face for my appointment. The doctor was very helpful with my requests

title: Great practice
body: The staff were welcoming and friendly. I was treated with respect and very quickly. The whole experience was extremely professional.

title: Great practice
body:
Nice practice 
think they keep up with the times 
all staff are very pleasant an helpful 
Well they always look after me an my family been going there since I was born with the Leiston surgery.

title: Flu Jab
body: Well organised at Corfe Hills School. Plenty of helpers on arrival, good number of vaccination stations and very quick turn around. Highly efficient practice.

title: A&E Doctor
body: The doctor who I saw in A&E was so thorough and explained everything and made me feel at ease, they were quite busy but nothing was too much trouble

title: Lucky to have such a great practice
body: I feel very lucky to be registered with The Allan Practice. It's really everything I could want from a doctor. Firstly, the care and service is top-notch - from our doctor to the reception and secretarial staff and the pharmacist and nurses. But I love the fact they make it so easy to get in touch - all done via an app with information to hand that's regularly updated. I'd almost go as far as saying that it's a pleasure to use them - if only it didn't mean there was a health issue!

title: Flu Clinic
body: I came to Corfe Hills School this morning to attend the flu clinic. It was very well organised, all the staff were cheerful and friendly, and I was in and out within a few minutes. Thank you all.

title: Minor surgery
body: Second time attending for minor surgery. The two nurses that attended to me made me feel relaxed and positive. I have had minor surgery in hospital before but have never felt so relaxed and positive like here at Beacon practice. Thank you.

title: Brilliant
body: From when I was taken to the ward for orthopaedics. I was looked after very well. When I was recovering from the anesthetic Marlon was absolutely brilliant. The care was absolutely brilliant.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Good practice
body:
Well run system for flu injections. Cheerfully staffed and efficient.
Slight confusion with venue instructions but easily sorted.

title: Flu and COVID jabs
body:
Once again, Leiston surgery has come up trumps!
Like a slick, well-oiled machine todays injections went very well and as always, the staff welcoming, friendly and helpful.
With all the negativity in the news today, we are so fortunate to have such an excellent surgery in this area. Thank you

title: Good service
body: I have had a biopsy at the surgery recently. Dr rang with results and referred me for hosp appt. Paperwork came within days to arrange appt. Thanyou to the doctor & everyone involved for your care whilst working under enormous pressure.

title: Outstanding - doctor and booking service
body: I visited this practice today after finding a worrying lump. I filled in the e-consult in the morning and received an appointment for the same afternoon. The doctor I saw was reassuring and kind - absolutely the kind of service that was needed at the time. She listened to my concerns and dealt with the issue professionally but with kind consideration that really made a worrying experience so much better.

title: Great experience
body: Flu and covid vaccines, all done to a high standard, very pleasant staff and doctor. This was my first visit to this practice and very happy with everything.

title: Great endoscopy team
body: Just had an colonoscopy at poole hospital. Have to praise the endoscopy team. My procedure was a hard one as so many polyps. 2.5 hours. I struggled, but the team got me through. Probably saved me a lot of troubles in future. Possibly my life. All detected by the bowel screening program. Great stuff!

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Real great practice
body:
I have just been for my flu jab and have to say this is the 4th year running I have taken up the opportunity to have the vaccination.
I was notified in plenty of time and given a range of dates and times to choose which one suited me the best.
When I got to the vaccination center this morning it was very well organised with plenty of helpers and staff.
I queued for about 5 minutes, had the jab and was back out in no time.
Thanks to the NHS and the Hadleigh Practice for looking after my health and wellbeing.

title: Covid and Flu Vaccinations
body: Well done and thank you to all the volunteers and doctors for the organisation of the flu and covid vaccinations this morning. Having downloaded my consent form last night, I was in and out in seconds. Thank you to everyone concerned.

title: Caring staff
body: I struggled to find exactly where I was going, but every member of staff I asked for help was so kind and helpful. When I used the mobile breast screening service, I couldn’t praise the staff enough. The member of staff who looked after me was amazing. She was so kind, considerate and compassionate.

title: Exemplary service
body: The staff are very professional, kind and non-judgemental. My consultation felt thorough and there was no sense of hurry. I recommend going here for sexual health concerns.

title: Excellent department
body: I attended the breast screening department today - what a wonderful caring group of people - from first arriving and throughout my appointment.  Each stage of the process ran like clockwork - everything was carefully explained - all staff so patient and understanding of how you’re feeling - a big thank you

title: Covid and flu jab
body: Excellent organisation, hardly any waiting time for flu and covid jabs. Staff friendly and helpful.

title: Great experience
body: Today I had my Covid booster and flu jabs. The experience was outstanding. I was in and out in minutes. Very friendly and helpful staff. Couldn’t have asked for any more.

title: Kindness and compassion!
body: Receptionist and lady calling people for their flu jabs were so warm and kind! And the Dr we saw was also so warm and friendly, didn’t rush us and listened so well. Checked my daughter over really well and eased my worries. With the amount of stress the NHS are under constantly they still all have smiles on their faces. Never been to a walk in before but we didn’t have to wait long at all. I was outside when I was called and they didn’t skip over me they came and got me so I am so happy. Really good experience I came away feeling reassured and happy. Thank you so much!

title: flu clinic
body: Very swift - lots of guides to show you the way into the hall, very short queue and jab swiftly administered. Everyone all bright and cheerful. Thank you all!

title: Excellent practice
body: Doctors are very caring, compassionate and professional. Receptionist are friendly and helpful. So grateful to them,the way they look after my elderly parents too. I would never want to go to any other surgery.

title: Easy Simple Process
body:
Joan & I attended the flu clinic at Corfe Hills School.
Well organised, straight in no hold ups, simple injection. 
Out in less than 5 minutes.

title: Nurse look after me well
body:
I have problems with sleeping. Nurse cares and understands my problems. She helps me and I think she is amazing. 
She follows my case and rang me to my surprise to tell me she has a solution. I am very grateful to have someone caring and wants to help me.

title: Efficient Flu Clinic
body: Attended a very well organised flu vaccination clinic, no waiting, guided straight through to a vacant vaccination station. All staff (some volunteers?) were welcoming and friendly.

title: Covid & Flu Vaccines
body: So well organised from text notification, booking online, checking in, and the appointment itself. Everyone was welcoming, helpful, and everything done with a smile. Thank you.

title: True professionals
body:
The staff on this ward  were wonderful. I felt very relaxed due to their care.  We are fortunate to have this wonderful service.
.Many thanks to all.

title: Poor practice
body: This practice is constantly not sending out medication and sending me into withdrawals. Which is highly damaging to my mental health and well being. Would 100% not recommend this surgery!!

title: Brilliant service as we have come to expect!
body: Needed my Covid vac early due to hospital appointment. All was organised and ran as smooth as silk. Thank you Leiston practice-you are brilliant!

title: econsult
body:
On 24th October I sent an econsult at 08:00, I received a conformation email within 2 minutes, at about midday I received a text informing me that contact would be be today or by end of tomorrow.
On the 25th October at 16:30 having had no contact I phoned the surgery, at 17:20 my call was answered. I informing of my problem, still waiting to hear from someone, I was told I should have had a call yesterday, I replied that I had none and there was no missed calls and nothing on my notes to state that someone had tried to contact me.
I was also informed that I was not on any lists to be called, being helpful I was then told I would be put on a list and called today. The doctor called me at about 18:30 and my problem dealt with.
If this is what I can expect using econsult I will go back to using the phone even if it means waiting half an hour to speak to a person.
I think this service needs to be overhauled to be improved, as I had to wait an additional day for my tablets and I waited in for two days for my call.

title: Failing Service
body: Everything is geared to online users.  I work and full time care for my Mum and have limited access to internet.  My 79 year old mother cannot even turn a computer on so constantly pushing people down an e-consult route is entirely inappropriate for much of the population - ironically the ones who likely will need the service most.  Earlier this week I rang and was told I was no 1 in the queue.  I got through to a receptionist and asked for a doctors call back having to again explain I have no or limited internet access (why can this not just be logged on a patient's record so they do not have to feel inadequate or embarrassed each time they call?)  My request was logged.  I was told I may not be called that day but the likelihood was that I would as I had called at 8.30am.  Given as a carer it is really hard to get any me time at all to take care of my own issues I initially felt assured by this.  However by midday the next day still no call at all.  I called the surgery again.  The receptionist apologised for the misleading impression I had been given and said I was scheduled to be called on Friday - 4 whole days after my phone call first thing in the morning when I clearly explained I had been in significant pain for months.  She offered to update the request to reflect when the call might be best for me, since I'd explained I was also due to take my Mum for an appointment on the Friday so having no clue as a carer when I'd be called was unhelpful.  When I stated when it would be good to call she then said she could not put a request for a time on the record.  So why on earth offer to if you cannot?  By now I just felt totally exasperated and was trying hard to explain I am a carer and I start a new job on Monday therefore if the doctor wants to see me (and I would really appreciate that) then I would need to be called early.  She said she would update the request.  She also said I should have been called back on the day I rang to be informed when I would be called.  (So now we are in the realms of calling people to tell them when you will call them...).  Needless to say it is now almost 2pm on the Friday and the doctor has still not called so any chance or hope I have of being seen this week when I know I will struggle massively next week due to a new job and caring commitments is virtually zero.  Surely vulnerable people are worth more than this and surely a record can reflect someone's ease of access to the internet and/or vulnerability so a doctor can better triage and prioritise?  I've had to use a neighbour's computer to even do this review.  I don't want to be unkind - many times the receptionists there have been patient and kind but the system simply does not work for patients who need it most.  And consultation feedback is only sought from people who are you, not too unhealthy and have internet access.  So you have redesigned a system to suit the people who need it least.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Physiotherapy
body: I started physio earlier this year and was in much pain with arthritis in my lower back and both hips. I was shown difficult excercises which at first I found painful to do now I’m much stronger thanks to my physio therapist. The pain doesn’t go but it eases it and I feel more mobile. Thank you

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very grateful
body:
My elderly mum was taken ill on a bus yesterday whilst out shopping. An ambulance was called & she was taken to Torbay Hospital.
 I’m so very grateful to all who cared for her. From the time she spend in the ambulance to when I collected  her this morning. 
I would like to say “Thank you” to the paramedics in the ambulance & all the staff in A & E who looked after her & made sure she was okay.

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust
Plymouth University,MNurs (Hons) Nursing (Adult Health and Mental Health) 2022

title: Forgotten or lost in the system.
body:
Referred by GP in February at request of KGH. Contacted by Highfield in April with a telephone appointment for the end of the month. Delay was Covid related I was told.  After describing my symptoms to the person who contacted me, I was told I would be referred to a Gastro Dietician. 
Never heard anything since.  It's now November.

title: Parking problem but otherwise great service
body: Use of the car park is monitored and subject to a fine: you must enter your car registration into a computer upon entry, which is poorly signed. Please improve the signage and communication to patients checking in at reception.

title: Very poor service again
body:
Receptionist phoned me to advise me the Doctor had ordered a blood test so would I like to book an appointment.
Booked an appointment for Thursday 03/11/22 at 11:00am.
Arrived for the appointment in plenty of time signed in with reception and was told take a seat.
I was sitting on that seat for 40 minutes that’s how late the appointment was.
I was called in to see the nurse who couldn’t find any Doctors orders for blood test on the computer.

title: Flu Clinic
body:
Went for my appt at Kirkway only to see a notice on the door that the flu clinic was being held at Corfe Hills School. I booked online for Kirkway and subsequent messages confirmed this. 
My experience of having the jab was good, just spoiled by the lack of communication as to venue.

title: Rude & upsetting experience at A&E Fracture Desk…
body: A really good experience for our 2 hours spent in A&E today, lovely staff & great support in children's A&E, X-Ray & Minor Injuries departments - all of whom we visited. Until unfortunately we had to hand a form in at the fracture desk on our departure. I asked one question - if there would be a time slot for the expected phone call & was 'barked' at by the person (who incidentally the desk had the closed blind half mast so looked like they weren't even working). Very rude and impolite, clearly not suitable for public facing duties talking to people in that manner - especially as I had just asked a question. Had my young daughter with me & was taken aback. Disgusting and completely overshadowed a really pleasant experience.

title: Lucky if you get an appointment
body: Husband & I have been patients for 15 yrs & this practice used to be great but no longer. My husband telephoned at 8am on 17/10/22 waited 30 mins to get through & surprise surprise no appointments when he eventually got through. Tried all week with same results & eventually on 21/10/22 got an appointment for 10/11/22 for telephone consultation! He is very chesty & how is a telephone consultation with a nurse going to help. I understand surgeries are under enormous pressure, however patients only get in touch with GP practices due to being unwell & it would be of help if patients could actually have face to face appointments. Covid cannot be used as a permanent excuse.  I do not like complaining regarding GP Practices but there comes a point where you just get fed up of being understanding.  I have noticed there is a big sign outside this practice stating they are taking on new patients.  This is absolutely ridiculous considering present patients cannot get an appointment via telephone or on line.  My husband has not been able to see a GP face to face for over 2 years.  Telephone consultations are a complete waste of time - we may as well ask a pharmacist!  I know from other family members that their GP practice ie Eaton Court in Castlevale do have face to face appointments and actually get an appointment - so why does this practice use Covid as an excuse.

title: Good experience
body: Apart from the occasional visit where I'm in the waiting room longer than expected, sometimes up to 20-30min over my appointment time, I cannot fault the service I've received from this surgery. For the jabs I received today, I was in and out of the the surgery within 5 minutes. The staff always treat me with courtesy and respect.

title: Excellent Experience
body: admitted on 28 october 2022 for baratric surgery my overall experience of both the environment and the care I received was outstanding. I was kept fully informed at all stages of what was happening. my care both pre and post op cannot be faulted. I was on robin ward which was bright pleasant and spotlessly clean. my personal wishes and preferences were sought and where possible met.  nursing staff were polite cheerful and very attentive.  Well done St Peters

title: Efficient and friendly
body: Attended flu jab clinic this morning. Well-organised and friendly. Was in and out in just under 5 minutes. Thank you.

title: Disgusting toilets in the A&E department
body:
I was taken, by the Ambulance service, to Lincoln Hospital A&E on October 28th. It was very busy and I had the need to use the ladies toilet. The state of the ladies toilets in the A&E department was absolutely appalling. 
One of the two toilets had a notice on the door to say it was blocked and the other one was full of faeces which I had to flush down before I could use the toilet.They obviously need some very urgent attention. Public toilets like this are a disgrace but this shouldn’t happen in a hospital where hygiene should be of the highest standard. 
Everyone was so busy and I wasn’t well at the time but I think you should be aware of the state of the toilets in the A&E dept.

readBy.name: Plymouth University,MNurs (Hons) Nursing (Adult Health and Mental Health) 2022

title: Amazing care and treatment
body: I am a 70 year old female. I feel and broke my wrist. From arriving at the hospital the care and treatment I received was second to none. My grateful thanks to all the lovely nursing staff and doctors in the A & E, the Fracture Clinic and Physio departments

readBy.name: Milton Keynes University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Bad treatment
body: I was at the Surgical Assessment Unit this week and another patient was in pain and being sick in another cubicle, she was on all fours on the bed, no one had bothered to give her any privacy, I appreciate they're busy but a few nurses came in and out and a nurse was sat at the station, it was only when a doctor came in and he pulled the curtain across, I felt for the lady

readBy.name: Plymouth University,MNurs (Hons) Nursing (Adult Health and Mental Health) 2022

title: Awful Follow Up
body: I was issued an emergency mental health prescription 6 days ago and have been to 8 chemists and the pharmacy 2 u website to try and access it. I have spent 3 hours on hold calling the Livi support team. I have raised 2 help requests. I've had multiple panic attacks and I'm now so distressed I'm scared to leave my house. Thanks, Livi, I hate you. You won't even acknowledge my refund request. Absolute disgraceful company just here to take your money.

readBy.name: Plymouth University,MNurs (Hons) Nursing (Adult Health and Mental Health) 2022

title: Room for Improvement!
body: Today I rang the surgery hoping to get an appointment this afternoon for my 81 year old mother. I considered it an urgent matter. I was told that they prioritise 0-12 year olds. My mother has paid into the NHS all her life. To be told in an urgent case, her needs are less of a priority was in my opinion unsatisfactory. Surgery isn't open anymore on a Saturday morning so she has to wait until Monday! I have noticed (and it isn't just this practice) them regularly stating they are fully booked up and yet the surgery is empty apart from one or two people, certainly not packed out like they used to be. Doctors are continuously proclaiming to be overstretched in terms of not enough hours in the day and yet there is definitely no evidence of this! Trying to get a Drs appointment these days is very frustrating. All walk-in centres nearby no longer exist and A&E is always full with a wait of between three and four hours. A radical shake up is well overdue.

readBy.name: Plymouth University, MSc Advanced Clinical Practitioner in Mental Health 2022
Plymouth University,MNurs (Hons) Nursing (Adult Health and Mental Health) 2022

title: efficiency
body: I found to be extremely efficient. Staff very accommodating. Appointment times generally on the same day,and waiting times no more than 5 to 10 minutes passed the appointed time slot..My experiences of the staff and doctors attending, I found to be more than adequate and professional.

readBy.name: Plymouth University,MNurs (Hons) Nursing (Adult Health and Mental Health) 2022

title: Fastest than a Formula 1 changing a tyre! :0)
body: Just attended my COVID booster. Received my booking text, then my reminder the day before (nice touch) then walked in to a friendly greeting, walk down to the room, sat down….didn’t feel I thing…done.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: lovely experience
body:
i had my first infusion for osteoporosis treatment today at the Davy unit in Cannock hospital. It was a surprisingly pleasant experience with knowledgable friendly staff who were able to answer my questions and put me at ease, IV was quick and painless ,unit and hospital spotlessly clean, comfortable environment and helpful advice for me to follow up with my GP. I would definately recommend this unit for treatment despite being further away for me. with ample parking and well signposted route to and in the hospital made for a pleasant 
morning that was more like coffee with friends than an outpatient appointment

title: Covid booster organised brilliantly
body: Great system. In and out within 5 or 6 mins. Staff and support workers were well organised. Will look forward to the next booster.

title: Lovely treatment
body: Had treatment for a hot water bottle burn and the doctor and nurse were lovely. I got all my info to them. Thank you to all the staff helping me.

title: Great experience
body: The service was good , the doctor treating me was very nice and all the doctors are professionally tied and everything goes well and I am really happy my all doctors and nurses and receptionist are always loving caring excellent caring loving support iam always go there and stay safe healthy time life safe this everything goes well

title: Leiston Surgery, Recommended
body:
Several health issues recently, all dealt with quickly and efficiently. 
Can’t praise the service highly enough!

title: Poor service for the old and vulnerable
body:
I have not been able to get a face to face appointment for my heard of hearing elderly mother. They have a ridiculous system of calling on the day between 0745 and 8.45 kept, it takes on average 30 mins to get through, then you are told the gp will call you at some point In the day, clearly my mother is unable to understand what the doctor is saying. I have had to take multiple days off work. Even when the gp phones, they would prefer to speak to one of her relatives on the phone, rather then see my mother face to face. It is both disappointing and worrying, even when I insist on a face to face appointment they say none available. They do nothing safeguard the old or vulnerable, to the point my mother  prefers to suffer in pain rather than go through the humiliation of trying to get an appointment or be seen.
  
This Gp surgery is not responsive to the needs of the patients.  I have asked my friends, most other Gp surgeries ask if the patient want to be seen face to face or have a telephone slot. It is a shame it is the only Gp surgery in our area. The NHs need to do something to address this.

title: Pain management
body:
Thank you to the surgeon. doctors. and nurses. at saundersons suit.your care is outstanding.i was admitted at 11am had pain relief procedures and was back home for 1.30pm
I would highly recomend this clinic to anyone with back pain.and other pain.you are all a credit to your profession.Thank You all

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Great service
body: This is a great GP practice. Everyone from doctors and nurses to the admin staff is helpful, competent and approachable. My special thanks go to the Lead GP for her kindness and warmth, especially dealing with kids. She managed to maintain and improve already high standards set by the previous senior GPs. Appointments are always available on the day with not unreasonable wait for a specific doctor. A well run and professional practice.

title: Good practice
body: Just had our Autumn flu & Covid jabs, we were treated really well by friendly & professional staff we were in & out in minutes, extremely happy

title: Great new Dr
body: Very impressed with the new lady doctor - really listened to me and my issue and took time to explain treatment, giving reassurance. Only complaint is that I pay for my prescriptions and I got 6 tablets for £9. Will soon need a second job as this is proving to take longer to treat than hoped for.

title: Good experience
body: I was greeted in a friendly manner at the flu clinic at Corfe Hills School. I didn't feel 'processed' and was dealt with promptly and professionally.

title: Covid vaccination
body: Plenty of friendly and helpful staff. My appt. was for 08.30. I was done and dusted by 08.33. The service was running like clockwork. Many thanks High town. Best wishes. David Archibald.

title: Covid + flu vaccine
body: Great experience. Volunteers friendly and helpful. Saturday afternoon, did not feel rushed. Calm atmosphere.Particularly liked the 2 young chaps (on reception and checking personal details in clinic) Thank you.

title: Very Efficient Service
body: Visited today to get my covid vaccination and was in and out in about three minutes.  All the staff on duty were extremely courteous and efficient.  Great service as ever.

readBy.name: Plymouth University, MSc Advanced Clinical Practitioner in Mental Health 2022

title: Very Caring Professionals
body: Had flu jab today at local vaccination session at Corfe Hills School. Wonderfully organised by Hadleigh Lodge and the whole process was carried out so efficiently.  Thank you.

title: Never felt a thing!
body: I attended a local school for my annual flu jab and as in previous years it was really well organised; people guiding you all the way with next to no queue at all. I was directed to 1 of half a dozen or so 'jabbers', the doctor asked a few precautionary questions and then gave me the injection, it was all over in a couple of minutes. A massive thanks to the team for giving up their Saturday.

title: Great Practice
body: I have been a patient at this surgery for many years and the staff are wonderful and very helpful. I can only recommend them

title: Professional service
body: I today received my flu and covid injections. The service was very efficiently provided. I had only a very short wait before I was called into the consultation room.

title: Efficient Jabs
body: I have just had my Covid and flu jabs at the Westgate Practice. The whole procedure was organised very well and I was impressed by the efficiency.

title: Amazing practice
body: Went for Covid and flu jab. Seamless organisation, still maintaining upgraded infection control. Also vigilant in regard to any underlying health issues. Professional and empathetic nurses. Moving to this practice several years ago was the best decision I have ever made in regard to looking after my health.

title: Restored my faith!
body:
I had an absolutely awful experience at my prev dr surgery. Marshalls Cross Medical Centre have restored my faith in GP services. The receptionist is amazing, so helpful and went out of her way to help me with a problem I had. All contact and requests are dealt with quickly and efficiently. 

Really pleased with everything. Thank you so much!

title: Great care with a human touch
body:
My son fractured his wrist in a football match and the care he received was excellent, professional and friendly.

While you never want to use ED services it's a bad day made better by these wonderful practitioners.

title: Thank you
body: I would like to thank the team at A&E for being so kind, I’ve unfortunately visited a few times with mental health and after being attacked. The kindness I’ve received is something I haven’t experienced in a long time and I want to make it known, the team at Macclesfield are incredible and have given me motivation to get better. Thank you all so much for taking the time - although you’re all so overwhelmed. I am so grateful, and your efforts have made so much difference to my journey. Thank you.

title: Great flu clinic
body: I had my flu jab this morning for the second year running.  Once again, it was a very efficient and friendly service. Well done everyone.

title: Outstanding professionalism and compassion
body:
We are writing to express our gratitude for the care, attention and professionalism shown to our dear, beloved dad in the last weeks of his life from his admission until his death. 
To begin with, we wish to thank the way the ambulance team reacted so swiftly to bring our dad to the hospital, delivered him safely and even returned after 4 hours to see how he was. The a&e department and the resuscitation team battled and were successful in saving our dad’s life, despite his low oxygen levels and sepsis. We were genuinely in awe, as they could not have done more to help dad during those crucial hours after we arrived at a&e. Though incredibly busy, as it was a Sunday night, they still had time to reassure us and also give a clear picture of dad’s condition with tender honesty. The assessment ward also contributed to how reassured we felt that dad was in the best of hands. 
When our dad was transferred to Ward 52, the high quality of attention and care continued. We are deeply thankful for staff kindness and communication during this difficult, uncertain and very sad time. The palliative care and bereavement teams were wonderfully responsive and professional.  All of these departments and every single member of the staff were just brilliant, down to earth, kind, honest and just outstanding at their jobs. Everyone at the hospital made what was a terrifying time for dad and our family easier, with their calm professionalism and genuine care and kindness. Whatever their position, whether consultant, doctor, nurse, the staff serving food, those which cleaned dad, all seemed equally proud to work at the hospital, to genuinely care and to show compassion to the people they were looking after. They took time to chat to patients and relatives, treated each one as an individual and with empathy. Everyone was amazing.
In addition to the unstinting dedication of the staff, we would also like to praise the impressive, effective teamwork, the efficient and highly reliable interdepartmental systems and infrastructure of the rvi as a hospital. All of these were exceptional. Our experience profoundly confirms how important and precious the National Health Service is in our society. We sincerely hope that staff can be valued and rewarded appropriately by the government in a way that reflects the calibre of their work and the vocational commitment they have.
By contrast, we have sadly experienced a broken and dysfunctional social care system that causes much stress and unnecessary suffering to families and their loved ones. The contrast between how it doesn’t work and how the nhs does, certainly in the example of the rvi, couldn’t be starker. 
The staff at the rvi as a whole ensured that we knew our dad was being cared for and his discomfort eased right until his final hour of life. 
We thank you from the bottom of our hearts and express our solidarity and support for the rvi as a superb nhs hospital.

title: Excellent and professional throughout
body:
Booked in for a routine minor surgerical procedure for men. Doctor was very pleasant and reassuring. They went through the whole procedure and put me at ease about what was happening. Both the doctor and nurse were very friendly and chatty whilst they diligently went about their work. They made sure to regularly check on me during the op and it was over and done with very quickly.

Highly recommend the practice, who have always been great and easy people to deal with. Thanks for your hard work!

title: Great Flu Clinic
body: Brilliant organising. In and out, jabbed in less than 5 minutes. Friendly, helpful volunteers. A real doctor doing the jab and no pain afterwards!

title: Amazing Staff
body:
I had to unfortunately come to A&E on a Saturday and expected it to be busy, it was, but the staff were very hard working and efficient. Every person I encountered was wonderful and helped to get further treatment as quick as possible, nurses, doctors, administrators and porters alike.

Thank you to everyone for all the hard work you do.
